Mission #{0:00}: Sink enemy ship
We have information that a crucial technology has been loaded onto the freighter {2}. It must be sunk at all costs. Its predicted location is {1}.

We suspect that the Americans are going to share a crucial technology under their Lend-Lease program. Our agents determined that a prototype device along with the necessary documentation was loaded onto {2} cargo ship. It must be sunk at all costs to delay this exchange. Our best estimate is that it's currently passing through a naval square {1} with a course of {3:0}°. The ship is moving in a convoy travelling at a speed of {4}.

Our diplomats have determined that the Americans are passing a newly built {2} {5} to our enemies in the Lend-Lease program. If opportunity will present itself, we need this ship to be sunk to decrease support for this policy. The ship is part of a convoy travelling at a speed of {4}. It's the only {2} {5} in the convoy. We estimate that the convoy is currently in a square {1} with a course course of {3:0}°. The {5} is most likely crewed with an inexperienced crew.

Our diplomats have determined that the British are passing a newly built {2} {5} to the Americans as part of their reverse Lend-Lease programme. If the opportunity presents itself, we need this ship to be sunk to decrease support for this policy. The ship is part of a convoy travelling at a speed of {4}. It's the only {2} {5} in the convoy. Our best estimate is that it's currently in a naval square {1} with a course of {3:0}°. The {5} is most likely crewed with an inexperienced crew.

Foreign radio reports that a major British military and political figure is on board of {2} {5} on {6}. The ship is moving with a group of other warships at a speed of {4}. We estimate that they are currently in a square {1} with a course of {3:0}°.

We have information that a major British military and political figure is on board of {2} {5} on {6}. The ship is part of a convoy moving at a speed of {4}. We estimate that the convoy is currently passing though a square {1} with a course of {3:0}°.

The enemy is transporting a large quantity of highly valuable cargo on board {2} cargo ship. Sinking it will help to disrupt both enemy trade and the exchange of industrial goods. We estimate that it's currently passing through a square {1} with a course of {3:0}°. The ship is moving in a convoy travelling at a speed of {4}.

A very valuable radar prototype is being transported on {2} cargo ship headed to {6} where it will be fitted onto a dedicated warship for testing. Sinking this ship will noticeably slow enemy progress in developing this technology. We estimate that it's currently passing through a square {1} with a course of {3:0}°. The ship is moving in a convoy travelling at a speed of {4}.

The enemy is passing a very valuable sonar prototype on board {2} cargo ship headed towards {6} where it will undergo further testing. Sinking that ship will noticeably slow enemy progress in developing this technology. We estimate that it's currently passing through a square {1} with a course of {3:0}°. The ship is moving in a convoy travelling at a speed of {4}.

A very valuable high-frequency direction finder prototype is being transported by {2} cargo ship headed to {6} where it will undergo further testing. Sinking this ship will noticeably slow enemy progress in developing  this technology. We estimate that it's currently passing through a square {1} with a course of {3:0}°. The ship is moving in a convoy travelling at a speed of {4}.
Mission #{0:00}: Gather intel

We need an update on air defenses in {2}. Arrive undetected at the location and identify the fire stations by periscope. It's a priority matter and overrides your current assignment that we now consider as finished.
Mission completed!
We managed to locate {1} anti-aircraft guns in {2}. Transmitting their positions.
Have a fruitful patrol U-96!
Report (value: {0})

Before noon on September 1, the transport vessel "Falcon" left port in Edinburgh. We have information that a radar technology prototype had been loaded onto it. We have reasons to think that the ship was sunk on its original course on the North Sea as a result of sabotage.

Your task is to find the wreckage, retrieve the equipment and if possible avoid being detected by the British units. We cannot be linked to the sabotage or attempts to seize the radar.

As a consequence of attacks by {0} against friendly units it is considered an enemy. Every German unit is commanded to force the submarine to capitulate or to sink it.

Stay very alert after you have sighted {0}.
Call for help
We were attacked by aircraft and sustained heavy damage. We are out of replacement parts. We are asking for help, meeting point {1}. We will stay there by {2}.
We've sustained heavy damage from depth charges and have many injured on board. We are lacking medical supplies. We need help, meeting point {1}. We will stay there by {2}.
Some of our crew shows signs of scurvy. We are asking nearby units to share some fresh supplies of vegetables or fruits. Meeting point {1}. We will stay there by {2}.

We will be coordinating a wolf pack attack on a convoy. All nearby u-boats are called to travel to meeting coordinates {0}. Convoy is expected to arrive there at {1:g} from the direction of {2:0} degrees.
The convoy has changed its course or already passed through the planned attack location. For this reason, we decided to disband this wolf pack.

Mission #{0:00}: Infiltrate {1}
Transport {2} to coordinates {3} near {1}. Report to us immediately after completion of this task.
Mission completed!
We transported {2} to the beach at specified coordinates.
We couldn't maintain spy's cover. Enemy was aware of our mission. We will return to port soon.

Our spy {1} communicated to us that his target in {0} is heavily guarded. His mission is top priority for us and has to be aided at all costs. Your order is to prepare any kind of diversion near the port to draw port defenses attention.
Mission completed!
We successfully drawn port defenses attention as ordered.
Mission #{0:00}: Attack {1}

In esteem to your resolve skills, high command decides to give you a special, dangerous task. Your order is to sneak into {1} and break enemy's spirits by showing them that their ships are not safe at any place. Use intelligence from the headquarters to get past enemy defences and in any case don't let your ship to fall into enemy hands. Abandon your objective and give us a full report, in case it would be too risky to proceed.
Mission completed!
We successfully sunk {2} enemy ships and now will escape the area.
We managed to sink {2} at the anchorage and retreated from the area. We are headed back to the port.
Mission #{0:00}: Join {1} Flotilla
Flotilla stationed at {1} needs more u-boats under its command to achieve the current goals. Your order is to travel to the target port and report to the new leading officer.
Mission completed!
We docked at {1} and reported to the officer.

United States Congress declares war upon Germany
Declaration happened hours after Germany first declared war on the United States after the attack on Pearl Harbor by the Empire of Japan. The vote was 88?0 in the Senate and 393?0 in the House.

Key: Message - USA Declares War on Japan.Title
English: War between Japan and the U.S.A.

Key: Message - USA Declares War on Japan
English: Since 7 December evening there is a state of war between Japan and the U.S.A.

Key: Message - Germany Declares War on USA.Title
English: The lifting of all restrictions regarding U.S.A. ships

Key: Message - Germany Declares War on USA
English:
The lifting of all restrictions regarding U.S.A. ships and the so-called Pan-American safety zone has been ordered by the high command. Therefore, the whole area of the American coasts will become open for operations by U-boats, an area in which the assembly of ships takes place in single traffic at the few points of departure of Atlantic convoys.

There is an opportunity here, therefore, of intercepting enemy merchant ships under conditions which have ceased almost completely for some time. Attempts must be made to utilize as quickly as possible these advantages, which will disappear very shortly, and to achieve a "spectacular success" on the American coast.

The following come into question as the main points of attack for such U-boat operations:
 	 	 	
 	Sydney Roads	2,200 miles
 	Halifax	2,400 miles
 	Bermudas	3,000 miles
 	New York	3,000 miles
 	Galveston	4,600 miles
 	Aruba	4,000 miles
 	Trinidad	3,600 miles (approach point for single traffic coming from South and bunkering station).
Laconia Order

Despite large Red Cross flag U 156 was bombed five times by an American "Liberator" type plane while towing 4 full life boats. Both periscopes temporarily out of order. Submarine stopped rescue work and transferred all survivors to the boats.  She was ordered to render no further assistance in any rescue attempts.

Once again all submarines have been told that the safety of our own boats must not be endangered in any circumstances. If necessary, take any steps, even breaking off all rescue work. As shown by the report from U 156, the Commanding Officer did not believe that the enemy would attack when he saw the Red Cross flag and the rescue attempts. This opinion is hard to understand. It must be assumed that he was influenced by seeing hundreds of survivors fighting for their lives.

Orders dealing with bringing captains and chief engineers back remain unchanged.
Italy Surrenders

The unconditional surrender of the Italian Armed Forces has set in motion the measures to be taken against Italy. The Command Station is ready to take over the immediate operational control of the Mediterranean boats.

At 2150 a radio message was received from F.d.U. Italy (Senior Officer Submarines, Italy):
 	"B.d.U. Please take over operational control".

 Control was taken over.
Rainbow order
All ships and submarines of the Kriegsmarine not suitable for fishing or mine-clearing have to be sunk in order not to have to hand them over to the enemy.
Gro?admiral D?nitz takes command

On the 30th of April the F?hrer has fallen with his soldiers in the heroic battle for Germany in Berlin. Grand Admiral D?nitz takes over the political leadership and the supreme command of the German troops. The battle of our people goes on.
Message from the Grand Admiral

My submarine men!

Six years of submarine warfare are behind us. You fought like lions. An overwhelming superiority has pushed us together in a very small space. It is no longer possible to continue the fight from the remaining base.

Submarine men! Unbroken and flawless, you lay down your arms after an unparalleled heroic battle. We remember with awe our fallen comrades who sealed their loyalty to the Fatherland with their death.

Comrades! Keep your brave submarine spirit, with which you have fought valiantly and undeterred for many years, also in the future for the good of our fatherland. Long live Germany!

Your Grand Admiral.
Surrender

All waves, Hubertus, North Sea.
Repeat every two hours.
To all boats. An unconditional surrender have come into terms. The following instruction from the representatives of the Allies must be followed immediately:
From now on only march surfaced.
Set a large black or blue flag.
Throw all ammunition outboard.
The ban on scuttling issued by the Allies or damage to a boat must be followed.
Your standing order is to surrender to the nearest Allied warships or at the nearest port.
Invasion of the Soviet Union

The crew of {1} received training in the basics of preparing a boat for a long range travel.
The crew of  {1} underwent a training mission during which they were trained in traveling, navigation and the basics of submarine diving.
The crew of  {1} underwent a training mission during which they were trained how to perform a successful torpedo attack.
The crew of {1} underwent a training mission to practice a first real-world patrol on the sea. They trained patrolling marked area and crisis management.
Training was given on how to prepare the crew on your u-boat for the challenges ahead. E.g. Sailor and officer recruitment, promotions, keeping officers in a reserve.
This training explained how to upgrade your boat.
Training was given on how to assign your officers to help with ongoing research and other tasks in Kriegsmarine headquarters.
Radio messages from: {0}

{1} was sunk north of Ireland by the enemy. There is a possibility that Enigma will fall into enemy hands. Skipper, we decided to send your u-boat with a bold mission that will prevent this from happening. Your order is to find the wreck of {1}, send a diver and recover the Enigma machine.

After consideration, we decided to assign this u-boat to one of the flotillas operating on Mediterranean Sea. Your order is to pass through the heavily guarded Gibraltar strait and report to your leading officer in La Spezia.

A cargo ship transporting vital cargo was sunk on the way from North Africa to Corsica. We want that cargo to be recovered. Our intel tells that it could be sunk at the following coordinates: {1}.

Skipper, your order is to locate that wreck, send a diver and recover the cargo. We shall remind you that everything involving this mission is a top secret.

Skipper, we send you on a bold mission to a distant island of Aruba.Our Intel tells that the enemy has weak defences on the island, despite that there is located one of the largest enemy oil refineries. Your order is to destroy at least three oil tanks in Port of Aruba using the deck gun installed on your ship.
Your order is to deploy a weather station on Bear Island.
Your order is to deploy a weather station in North Labrador.
Mission #{0:00}: Escort duty
Escort duty complete
We've completed to escort the troopships and will head back to the base.
Convoy under attack!
SOS SOS We are under attack by the enemy warships. We are calling for assistance.

Our convoy departed towards {1}. Skipper, it will be escorted by destroyers, but due to urgency we decided to assign your u-boat to provide them with assistance. Use hydrophones on your boat to early and quickly locate incoming dangers before they reach the convoy. It's vital that this convoy arrives intact to its destination.

Skipper, it came to our attention that your u-boat is travelling along with the escorted convoy for some time. Please gain some distance from it. The noise in convoy's vincinity will reduce hydrophone's effectiveness.

Remember, that destroyers are here to protect the troopship in case of an unexpected attack. Your main objective is to detect incoming dangers and eliminate them before they have a chance to get close.

Good luck.
